_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This Executive Summary briefly describes the major elements of the Risk Management Plan (RMP) for BioUrja Port Allen, LLC (BioUrja).  This summary is presented in response to the requirements of the United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) under Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations, Part 68 (40 CFR 68) and Section 112(r) of the Clean Air Act.  The BioUrja Port Allen facility is subject to the RMP rule due to the storage of Propane, Butane, and Y-Grade Mass (a flammable mixture), which contains liquified petroleum gases, n-pentane, isopentane, hexanes, and hydrogen sulfide, which are regulated substances above the threshold quantities.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES:

BioUrja Port Allen is committed to the protection of its employees, the greater community and the environment from any hazardous substances stored at the facility.  It is the policy of BioUrja Port Allen to comply with all Federal, State and Local laws. The BioUrja Port Allen facility has a detailed Emergency Response Plan that is utilized to respond to any accidental releases. 

BioUrja Port Allen has emergency response policies in place that are addressed in the facility's Health and Safety Plan and Industrial Storm Water Pollution Prevention Plan (SWPPP). Most of the listed Plans have annual training requirements (at a minimum) to keep employees educated on emergency response procedures in place at the facility.  All new employees are required to attend orientation where the Plans listed above are reviewed.  New employees also undergo training on emergency response procedures prior to initiating responsibilities onsite.



BioUrja Port Allen's policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances.  However, if a release does occur, facility personnel will respond defensively to contain the release as necessary.



DESCRIPTION OF STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED:

BioUrja Port Allen is lo

cated in Port Allen, West Baton Rouge Parish, Louisiana.  The facility operates 24 hours per day, 7 days per week for the purpose of storing propane, butane, Y-Grade Mass. 



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS:

BioUrja Port Allen is committed to the protection of its employees, the greater community and the environment from any hazardous substances stored at the facility, especially propane, butane, Y-Grade Mass.  It is the policy of BioUrja Port Allen to comply with all Federal, State and Local laws. BioUrja Port Allen's maintenance staff performs regular preventative maintenance inspections, as required by the manufacturer's recommendations and/or State and Federal regulations.  Monthly and quarterly visual inspections are performed and documented.  



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:

The facility has not had any accidents reportable under RMP within the past five years.  



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:

BioUrja Port Allen has several safety programs in place at the facility that incorporate emergency response, including the Health and Safety Plan.  BioUrja Port Allen also maintains an Emergency Action Plan that details evacuation and response procedures for spills, releases, and fire, etc.  The plans listed in this section have been prepared in accordance with applicable regulations.  Training is conducted in accordance with these plans and applicable requirements. 



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:

BioUrja Port Allen provides safety training to its employees on an annual basis.  Contractors are trained on plant-specific safety procedures prior to initiating work onsite.  Any changes to improve safety will be implemented immediately upon discovery of needed changes.
